info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 04 at 1:25PM MDT until June 05 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE WOODS CREEK AND DEEP CREEK BURN SCARS REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Woods Creek and Deep Creek Burn Scars. * WHERE...Portions of central and southwest Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Meagher. In southwest Montana, Broadwater. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Woods Creek and Deep Creek Burn Scars is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Woods Creek and Deep Creek Burn Scars should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas and debris flows in and near wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting the potential for heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
